original: mi'am ci'i rgyal po bzhi 'di lta ste /🔽mi 'am ci'i rgyal po @5a *//
analyzed: mi'am ci'i rgyal po bzhi 'di lta ste / mi 'am ci'i rgyal po @5a *//
translated: There were also four kinnara kings:

analyzed: ljon pa dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po chos chen dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po chos bzang dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po chos 'dzin dang / 'khor mi'am ci bye ba brgya stong mang po dag dang yang thabs gcig go /
translated: Dhruva, Mahādharma, Sudharma, and Dharmadhara, each with a retinue of many hundreds of thousands of kinnaras.

original: dri za'i ris kyi lha'i bu bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dri za'i ris kyi lha'i bu bzhi 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dri za yid du 'ong ba dang / yid 'ong dbyangs dang / 'jam snyan dang / dri za dbyangs snyan dang / 'khor dri za bye ba brgya stong mang po dag dang yang thabs gcig go /

original: lha ma yin gyi dbang po bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po bzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: There were also four lords of the asuras:

analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po stobs can dang / phrag rtsub dang / thags bzang ris dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan dang / 'khor lha ma yin bye ba brgya stong mang po dag dang yang thabs gcig go /
translated: the asura lords Balī, Śāṭhya, Vemacitrin, and Rāhu, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of retinues of asuras.

original: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po bzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: There were also four lords of the garuḍas:

analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po gzi brjid chen po dang / lus chen po dang / rdzogs chen dang / nam mkha' lding gi dbang po 'phrul chen thob dang / 'khor nam mkha' lding bye ba brgya stong mang po dang yang thabs gcig go /
translated: the garuḍa king Great Splendor, Great Body, Great Perfection, and the garuḍa king Great Magical Attainment, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of garuḍa retinues;

original: lus 'phags ma'i bu yul ma ga dh'a'i rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang yang thabs gcig go /
analyzed: lus 'phags ma'i bu yul ma ga dh'a'i rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang yang thabs gcig go /
translated: and Ajātaśatru, the king of Magadha, son of the Videha people.

original: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das 'khor bzhi po de dag gis yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te /🔽bsti stang du byas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das 'khor bzhi po de dag gis yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te / bsti stang du byas /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was surrounded and revered by the fourfold assembly,🔽honored,🔽respected,

original: btsun par byas /🔽ri mor byas /
analyzed: btsun par byas / ri mor byas /
translated: revered,

original: mchod par byas /🔽brjed par byas /
analyzed: mchod par byas / brjed par byas /
translated: worshipped,

original: @5b gsol ba byas te /
analyzed: @5b gsol ba byas te /

analyzed: nges par bstan pa chen po zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs mdo sde shin tu rgyas pa chen po byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams pa /

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba bshad par bzhed de /
translated: which is upheld by all buddhas.

original: chos kyi gdan de nyid la skyil mo krung bcas nas /
analyzed: chos kyi gdan de nyid la skyil mo krung bcas nas /

analyzed: mtha' yas nges par bstan pa'i gnas zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te sku mi g-yo zhing sems mi g-yo bar gyur nas bzhugs so //

original: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
translated: As soon as the Blessed One entered meditative absorption,

original: bcom ldan 'das la lha'i me tog mand'a ra dang / mand'a ra chen po dang / manydzu sha ka dang / manydzu sha ka chen po rnams kyi me tog gi char chen po mngon par bab ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das dang 'khor bzhi po de dag la 'thor ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang 'khor bzhi po de dag la 'thor ro //
translated: They were scattered over the Blessed One and the fourfold assembly.

original: thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur te /🔽'gul / kun tu rab tu 'gul /🔽ldeg / kun tu rab tu ldeg /
analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur te / 'gul / kun tu rab tu 'gul / ldeg / kun tu rab tu ldeg /
translated: The entire buddha field shook in six ways:🔽it trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;

original: 'khrugs / kun tu rab tu 'khrugs so //
analyzed: 'khrugs / kun tu rab tu 'khrugs so //
translated: it quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;🔽and it shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely.

original: de'i tshe dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, upāsikās, devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas,

analyzed: mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams dang / rgyal phran dang / stobs kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba dang / gling bzhi'i 'khor los bsgyur ba @6a *//
translated: humans, non-humans, minor kings, powerful cakravartins, and the cakravartins of the four continents

analyzed: gang dag 'khor der 'dus nas 'khod par gyur pa 'khor dang bcas pa de dag thams cad bcom ldan 'das la lta zhing 'khod de ngo mtshar du gyur /

original: rmad du gyur /
analyzed: rmad du gyur /
translated: astonished,

original: shin tu dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: shin tu dga' bar gyur to //

analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer gcig byung nas /

analyzed: de shar phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing khri brgyad stong du song ste /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen po yan chad srid pa'i rtse mo man chad 'od zer de'i 'od kyis shin tu khyab par snang ngo //
translated: All those buddha-fields, from the great Avīci hell up to the peak of existence, were completely pervaded by the light of that ray.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi 'gro ba drug po de dag na sems can gang yod pa de dag thams cad ma lus par snang ngo //
translated: All the beings in the six destinies that exist in those buddha-fields were seen without exception.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs shing 'tsho gzhes pa de dag thams cad kyang snang ngo //
translated: All the bhagavān buddhas who were present, living, and teaching in those buddha-fields were seen.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag chos gang 'chad pa de dag thams cad kyang ma lus par grag go /

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / rnal 'byor can dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa gang dag 'bras bu thob pa dang / 'bras bu ma thob pa de dag thams cad kyang snang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / rnal 'byor can dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa gang dag 'bras bu thob pa dang / 'bras bu ma thob pa de dag thams cad kyang snang ngo //
translated: In those buddha-fields, all the monks, nuns, laymen and laywomen, yogis and yoginis, whether they have attained the fruits or not, are visible.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na /
translated: In those buddha-fields,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @6b dpa' chen po gang dag nyan pa dang / dmigs pa dang / mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma'i rgyu'i thabs mkhas pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa de dag thams cad kyang snang ngo //
translated: all the bodhisattva-mahasattvas who are practicing the bodhisattva conduct through various causes of listening, contemplation and meditation, through skillful means, are visible.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na /
translated: In those buddha-fields,

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag thams cad kyang snang ngo //
translated: all the bhagavat buddhas who are passing into parinirvana are visible.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na /
translated: In those buddha-fields,

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi ring bsrel gyi mchod rten rin po che las byas pa de dag thams cad kyang snang ngo //
translated: All the stūpas made of precious materials that contained the relics of the bhagavān buddhas who had passed into nirvāṇa were also visible.

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: kye ma de bzhin gshegs pas ltas cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa 'di 'dir ci'i rgyur 'gyur zhig gu /

analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ltas cho 'phrul chen po 'di lta bu 'di bstan te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs shing /

analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'di sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la lhag par bya ba byas pa /

analyzed: pa ste; 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'dis sngon chad kyang sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ltas 'di lta bu byung ba rnams mthong zhing sngon chad chos chen po'i 'bel ba'i gtam dag kyang myong bas
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta has seen such omens of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past, and he has experienced the great Dharma discourses of the past.

analyzed: na / bdag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la de'i don dri'o snyam du sems so //
translated: I shall ask Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta about this matter.”

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor bzhi po de dag dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor bzhi po de dag dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
translated: the fourfold assembly of monks, nuns, male lay followers, and female lay followers, and many gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras,

analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa mang po de dag kyang /
translated: mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ltas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul chen po'i snang ba 'di lta bu 'di mthong nas ngo mtshar du gyur /

analyzed: ltad mor gyur te 'di snyam du /
translated: and filled with wonder, and thought,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul chen po'i snang ba 'di lta bu 'di bstan pa bdag cag gis su la dri snyam du sems so //

translated: Then, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, having understood the thoughts of the fourfold assembly in that very instant, that very moment, that very second, said this to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

analyzed: 'jam dpal / @7b bcom ldan 'das kyis ltas ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba rdzu 'phrul gyi snang ba 'di lta bu 'di bstan te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing khri brgyad stong po 'di dag rnam par bkra ba /

analyzed: lha rnams dga' bas tsandan phye ma dang // lha yi spos rab yid du 'ong ba dang // mand'a ra dang manydzu sha ka yi //

analyzed: des ni sa 'di kun tu mdzes gyur cing //

translated: pure action in the middle, and pure action in the end.

original: don bzang po tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: don bzang po tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: It has excellent meaning and excellent words.

original: ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: It is unadulterated, complete,🔽pure, and refined.

original: yongs su byang ba yang dag par ston te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba yang dag par ston te 'di lta ste /
translated: It is taught as follows:

original: nyan thos rnams la ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir /
translated: For the hearers, it is in order to transcend birth, aging, sickness, death, misery, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa'i chos ston to //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las brtsams te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa'i chos ston to // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las brtsams te /
translated: He teaches the Dharma that is endowed with the four noble truths and the entry into dependent origination, which culminates in nirvāṇa.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi @13b mthar thug pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi @13b mthar thug pa'i chos ston to //
translated: To the bodhisattva mahāsattvas he teaches the Dharma that is endowed with the six perfections and culminates in omniscient wisdom, beginning with unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ma pham pa /
analyzed: ma pham pa /
translated: “Ajita,

original: 'di ltar yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla sgron ma de sngon gzhon nur gyur cing khab na bzhugs pa las mngon par ma byung ba'i tshe sras brgyad yod par gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla sgron ma de sngon gzhon nur gyur cing khab na bzhugs pa las mngon par ma byung ba'i tshe sras brgyad yod par gyur te /
translated: in that way, when the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candra­sūrya­pradīpa was a young man living in the inner palace, before he had left his home, he had eight sons.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were:

original: rgyal bu gzhon nu blo gros zhes bya ba dang / bzang po'i blo gros dang / mtha' yas blo gros dang / dkon mchog blo gros dang / khyad par blo gros dang / the tshom kun bcom dang / dbyangs kyi blo gros dang / rgyal bu gzhon nu chos kyi blo gros zhes bya ba yod do //
analyzed: rgyal bu gzhon nu blo gros zhes bya ba dang / bzang po'i blo gros dang / mtha' yas blo gros dang / dkon mchog blo gros dang / khyad par blo gros dang / the tshom kun bcom dang / dbyangs kyi blo gros dang / rgyal bu gzhon nu chos kyi blo gros zhes bya ba yod do //
translated: Prince Mati, Prince Bhadramati, Prince Anantamati, Prince Ratnamati, Prince Viśeṣamati, Prince Sarvasamśayaccheda, Prince Ghoṣamati, and Prince Dharmamati.

original: ma pham pa; bcom ldan 'das nyi zla sgron ma de'i sras rgyal bu gzhon nu brgyad po de dag rdzu 'phrul chen por gyur te /
analyzed: ma pham pa; bcom ldan 'das nyi zla sgron ma de'i sras rgyal bu gzhon nu brgyad po de dag rdzu 'phrul chen por gyur te /
translated: “Ajita, those eight princes, the sons of the Bhagavat Sūryacandrasūryapradīpa, were of great miracles.

original: de dag re re'ang gling chen po bzhi la kun tu longs spyod par gyur cing de dag na rgyal po byed do //
analyzed: de dag re re'ang gling chen po bzhi la kun tu longs spyod par gyur cing de dag na rgyal po byed do //
translated: Each of them enjoyed the four great continents and was a king there.

original: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das de khab nas mngon par byung bar shes shing /
analyzed: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das de khab nas mngon par byung bar shes shing /
translated: They knew that the Bhagavat had left the palace

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par thos nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par thos nas /
translated: and had heard that he had attained the highest, complete enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: rgyal po'i longs spyod thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i longs spyod thams cad spangs te /
translated: They gave up all the enjoyments of the king🔽and,

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i rjes su rab tu byung nas thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs te chos smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i rjes su rab tu byung nas thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs te chos smra bar gyur to //
translated: “Bhagavān, after that, they all went forth and became Dharma teachers who were established in the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: rgyal bu gzhon nu de dag rtag tu tshangs par spyod cing sangs rgyas brgya stong mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par @14a *//🔽gyur to; ;ma pham pa /
analyzed: rgyal bu gzhon nu de dag rtag tu tshangs par spyod cing sangs rgyas brgya stong mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par @14a *// gyur to; ;ma pham pa /
translated: “Those young princes always practiced celibacy and created roots of merit with many hundreds of thousands of buddhas.

analyzed: de'i tshe na'ang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla sgron ma des /

analyzed: de'i tshe skad cig thang cig yud tsam de nyid la 'khor 'dus pa de nyid du chos kyi gdan chen po de nyid la skyil mo krung bcas te /
translated: At that time, in that very instant, in that very moment, in that very second, in the midst of the assembly, on the great Dharma seat, he crossed his legs.

original: mtha' yas nges par bstan pa'i gnas zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te sku mi g-yo zhing sems mi g-yo bar gyur nas bzhugs so //

translated: He entered the samādhi called “the abode of the teaching of infinity,” and his body and mind became unmoving.

original: bcom ldan 'das de snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
translated: As soon as the Bhagavān entered samādhi,

original: bcom ldan 'das la me tog mand'a ra ba dang / mand'a ra ba chen po dang / manydzu sha ka dang / manydzu sha ka chen po dang / lha'i me tog dag gis char chen po mngon par bab ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la me tog mand'a ra ba dang / mand'a ra ba chen po dang / manydzu sha ka dang / manydzu sha ka chen po dang / lha'i me tog dag gis char chen po mngon par bab ste /
translated: a great rain of divine flowers, mandārava and mahāmandārava flowers, and māndārava and mahāmandārava flowers fell upon the Bhagavān and his assembly.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa la mngon par 'thor ro //

analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos par gyur te /
translated: The entire buddha realm shook in six ways:

original: 'gul / kun tu rab tu 'gul /
analyzed: 'gul / kun tu rab tu 'gul /
translated: it trembled, trembled strongly,🔽and trembled intensely;

original: ldeg / kun tu rab tu ldeg /
analyzed: ldeg / kun tu rab tu ldeg /
translated: shook,

original: 'khrugs / kun tu rab tu 'khrugs so //
analyzed: 'khrugs / kun tu rab tu 'khrugs so //
translated: trembled, and quaked.

original: ma pham pa /
analyzed: ma pham pa /
translated: Anavatapta,

original: yang de'i tshe 'khor der dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / @14b dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe 'khor der dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / @14b dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
translated: at that time, in that assembly, there were monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras,

original: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams dang / rgyal phran dang / stobs kyi 'khor lo sgyur ba dang / gling bzhi'i 'khor los bsgyur ba rnams 'dus nas 'khod par gyur pa 'khor dang bcas pa de dag thams cad bcom ldan 'das la lta zhing ngo mtshar du gyur /🔽rmad du gyur /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams dang / rgyal phran dang / stobs kyi 'khor lo sgyur ba dang / gling bzhi'i 'khor los bsgyur ba rnams 'dus nas 'khod par gyur pa 'khor dang bcas pa de dag thams cad bcom ldan 'das la lta zhing ngo mtshar du gyur / rmad du gyur /
translated: mahoragas, humans, non-humans, minor kings, powerful cakravartins, and the four-continent cakravartins. Having gathered and taken their seats, all of them, together with their retinues, looked at the Blessed One with wonder and amazement,

original: dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: dga' bar gyur to //
translated: and became filled with joy.

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa nyi zla sgron ma'i smin mtshams kyi bar gyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer gcig byung nas de shar phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyi khrir byung ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa nyi zla sgron ma'i smin mtshams kyi bar gyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer gcig byung nas de shar phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyi khrir byung ste /
translated: Then, at that time, from the space between the eyebrows of the bhagavat, the tathagata Sun and Moon Light, a single ray of light appeared and extended to twenty thousand buddha realms in the east.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad 'od zer de'i 'od kyis shin tu khyab par snang bar gyur te; ma pham pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad 'od zer de'i 'od kyis shin tu khyab par snang bar gyur te; ma pham pa /
translated: All of those buddha realms were completely filled with the light of that ray of light.🔽Ajita, it was like

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: this:

original: dper na / da ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di dag snang bar gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / da ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di dag snang bar gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: for example, it was as if all of these buddha realms were illuminated.

original: ma pham pa /🔽yang de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs 'bring na /
analyzed: ma pham pa / yang de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs 'bring na /
translated: Ajita,🔽at that time, the bhagavat had twenty million bodhisattvas in his retinue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag nyi shu 'khod pa dang / 'khor de na chos nyan pa de dag 'od zer chen po'i snang ba des 'jig rten snang bar byas pa mthong nas ngo mtshar du 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag nyi shu 'khod pa dang / 'khor de na chos nyan pa de dag 'od zer chen po'i snang ba des 'jig rten snang bar byas pa mthong nas ngo mtshar du 'gyur /
translated: Those who were listening to the dharma in that assembly saw the great ray of light that illuminated the world. They were amazed,

original: rmad du gyur te /
analyzed: rmad du gyur te /
translated: astonished,

original: ltad mo cher byung ngo //
analyzed: ltad mo cher byung ngo //
translated: and greatly delighted.

original: ma pham pa /
analyzed: ma pham pa /
translated: Ajita,

original: de'i tshe na yang bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'od mchog ces bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na yang bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'od mchog ces bya ba byung ste /
translated: At that time, in the doctrine of that Bhagavat, there was a bodhisattva mahāsattva named Varaprabha.

original: @15a *// de'i slob ma brgyad brgya yod do //
analyzed: @15a *// de'i slob ma brgyad brgya yod do //
translated: He had eight hundred disciples.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'ang ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od mchog las brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'ang ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od mchog las brtsams te /
translated: That Bhagavat, having arisen from that samādhi, began with the bodhisattva Varaprabha

original: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par ston te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par ston te /
translated: and taught the Dharma discourse of the Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: bar gyi bskal pa drug cu tshang bar gdan gcig la bzhugs nas sku mi bskyod /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa drug cu tshang bar gdan gcig la bzhugs nas sku mi bskyod /
translated: For a full sixty intermediate eons he sat on one seat, his body motionless,

original: sems mi g-yo bar bshad do //
analyzed: sems mi g-yo bar bshad do //
translated: his mind unmoving.

original: 'khor de dag thams cad kyang stan gcig la 'khod de /
analyzed: 'khor de dag thams cad kyang stan gcig la 'khod de /
translated: The entire assembly also sat on one seat,

original: lus mi bskyod sems mi g-yo bar bar gyi bskal pa drug cur bcom ldan 'das de la chos nyan te /
analyzed: lus mi bskyod sems mi g-yo bar bar gyi bskal pa drug cur bcom ldan 'das de la chos nyan te /
translated: their bodies motionless, their minds unmoving, for sixty intermediate eons listening to the Dharma from that Bhagavat.

original: 'khor de na sems can 'ga' yang lus ngal ba'ang med /
analyzed: 'khor de na sems can 'ga' yang lus ngal ba'ang med /
translated: There was not a single being in that assembly who was physically tired

original: sems skyo ba'ang med do //
analyzed: sems skyo ba'ang med do //
translated: or mentally weary.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla sgron mas bar gyi bskal pa drug cu 'das kyi bar du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla sgron mas bar gyi bskal pa drug cu 'das kyi bar du /
translated: Then the bhagavat, the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Sun and Moon Lamp, for sixty intermediate eons,

original: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i chos kyi rnam grangs mdo sde shin tu rgyas pa chen po byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams pa /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i chos kyi rnam grangs mdo sde shin tu rgyas pa chen po byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams pa /
translated: taught the Dharma discourse of the Dharma Flower Sutra, the great extensive sutra, the instruction for bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba bshad nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba bshad nas /
translated: the sutra that is protected by all buddhas.

original: skad cig de nyid la mya ngan las 'da'o zhes lha dang bcas /🔽bdud dang bcas /
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la mya ngan las 'da'o zhes lha dang bcas / bdud dang bcas /
translated: Then, in that very instant, he entered nirvana.🔽In the presence of the world with its celestial beings,🔽the world with its maras and Brahmas,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i mdun du /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i mdun du /
translated: the world with its sramanas and brahmans,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: he said to the bhikshus:

original: do mod nam gyi gung thun la de bzhin gshegs pa phung po'i lhag ma @15b med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: do mod nam gyi gung thun la de bzhin gshegs pa phung po'i lhag ma @15b med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Tonight at midnight the Tathagata will enter parinirvana, the realm of extinction with no remainder of the aggregates.”

original: ma pham pa /
analyzed: ma pham pa /
translated: Ajita!

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla sgron ma des /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla sgron ma des /
translated: Then the bhagavat, the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Sun and Moon Light🔽gave a prophecy of the bodhisattva mahasattva Glorious Essence’s unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal gyi snying po zhes bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan nas 'khor de dag thams cad la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal gyi snying po zhes bya ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan nas 'khor de dag thams cad la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He then said to the whole assembly,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi snying po 'di /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi snying po 'di /
translated: this bodhisattva Glorious Essence

original: nga'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: nga'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: will, after me, manifest the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dri ma med pa'i spyan zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gsungs so; ;ma pham pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dri ma med pa'i spyan zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gsungs so; ;ma pham pa /
translated: He will be the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Stainless Eyes.”🔽Ajita,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla'i sgron ma de'i nub mo nam gyi gung thun la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi zla'i sgron ma de'i nub mo nam gyi gung thun la /
translated: Then, in the middle of the night, the Bhagavat, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Candrasuryapradipa

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: entered into the realm of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates.

translated: Śāriputra,

original: de la nga ye shes kyi stobs dang ldan zhing rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang ldan zhes gal te thabs ma yin pas sems can 'di dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams thob par byas su zin na /
analyzed: de la nga ye shes kyi stobs dang ldan zhing rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang ldan zhes gal te thabs ma yin pas sems can 'di dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams thob par byas su zin na /
translated: if I were to give these beings the wisdom, strengths, and fearlessnesses of the Tathāgata through a method that was not skillful,

original: sems can 'di dag chos 'di dag gis nges par 'byung par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag chos 'di dag gis nges par 'byung par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: these beings would not be liberated by these dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: sems can 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la shin tu chags pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la shin tu chags pa /
translated: These beings are attached to the five sense pleasures.

original: sems can 'di dag ni khams gsum gyi dga' ba la shin tu chags pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni khams gsum gyi dga' ba la shin tu chags pa /
translated: These beings are attached to the joys of the three realms.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan @50b dang; smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las ma thar ba /🔽bsreg btso gdung /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan @50b dang; smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las ma thar ba / bsreg btso gdung /
translated: They are not free from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress.

original: yongs su gdung ba /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba /
translated: They are burned, boiled, and scorched.🔽They are tormented.

original: steng g-yogs dang / gdung phyam 'bar ba'i khyim dang 'dra ba'i khams gsum nas ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: steng g-yogs dang / gdung phyam 'bar ba'i khyim dang 'dra ba'i khams gsum nas ma byung ba ste /
translated: They have not emerged from the three realms, which are like a house with a burning roof and rafters.🔽The Thus-Gone One sees that they will enjoy the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la ji ltar longs spyod par 'gyur zhes de bzhin gshegs pas de ltar gzigs so; ;de la sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la ji ltar longs spyod par 'gyur zhes de bzhin gshegs pas de ltar gzigs so; ;de la sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar skyes bu lag stobs can des lag stobs bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu lag stobs can des lag stobs bzhag ste /
translated: it is like this: The man of a hundred powers has set aside his strength.

original: thabs mkhas pas gzhon nu de dag khyim 'bar ba de nas 'don te /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas gzhon nu de dag khyim 'bar ba de nas 'don te /
translated: With skillful means he led those children out of the burning house.

original: bton nas de dag phyis rlabs che ba'i bzhon pa chen po byin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bton nas de dag phyis rlabs che ba'i bzhon pa chen po byin pa de bzhin du /
translated: After they were out, he gave them great, magnificent carts.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhag ste /
translated: in the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha, who has the Tathāgata’s wisdom, strengths, and fearlessnesses, sets aside the Tathāgata’s wisdom, strengths, and fearlessnesses.

original: thabs mkhas pa'i ye shes kyis gdung phyam dang steng g-yongs 'bar ba'i khyim dang 'dra ba'i khams gsum nas sems can rnams 'don pa'i phyir theg pa gsum ston pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i ye shes kyis gdung phyam dang steng g-yongs 'bar ba'i khyim dang 'dra ba'i khams gsum nas sems can rnams 'don pa'i phyir theg pa gsum ston pa 'di lta ste /
translated: With the wisdom of skillful means, in order to lead out beings from the three realms, which are like the burning house, he teaches the three vehicles:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ste /
translated: the Śrāvakayāna, the Pratyeka­buddha­yāna, and the Bodhisattva­yāna.

original: theg pa gsum gyis sems can rnams drangs te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis sems can rnams drangs te /
translated: He leads out beings by means of the three vehicles.

original: de dag la 'di skad ces gsungs te /🔽khyed cag khyim 'bar ba dang 'dra @51a *//
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces gsungs te / khyed cag khyim 'bar ba dang 'dra @51a *//
translated: He said to them:

original: pa'i khams gsum gyi gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ngan pa la dga' bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: pa'i khams gsum gyi gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ngan pa la dga' bar ma byed cig /
translated: “You should not delight in the bad forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures of the three realms, which are like a burning house.

original: khyed cag khams gsum 'dir mngon par dga' bas 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dang bcas pa'i sred pas bsreg btso gdung //🔽yongs su gdung bar gyur gyi /
analyzed: khyed cag khams gsum 'dir mngon par dga' bas 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan dang bcas pa'i sred pas bsreg btso gdung // yongs su gdung bar gyur gyi /
translated: You are being burned, scorched, and tormented by craving for the five sense pleasures in this three-realm world.

original: khams gsum 'di nas 'byung ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khams gsum 'di nas 'byung ba 'di lta ste /
translated: You should escape from this three-realm world by means of the vehicles, which are like the three escape routes:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ste /
translated: the vehicle of the hearers, the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.
